3.5.1.title: Purpose and Function
3.5.1.content:
**Purpose:**
Control flow from the well during well control operations:
- Allow controlled circulation during kill
- Maintain back pressure on annulus
- Direct flow to appropriate destination
- Provide pressure control point

**Location:**
Downstream of BOP, connected via choke line

**Key Function:**
The choke is the PRIMARY PRESSURE CONTROL DEVICE during kill operations. Proper choke operation maintains constant bottomhole pressure.

3.5.2.title: Components
3.5.2.content:
**Chokes:**
- Adjustable choke (manual or remote operated)
- Fixed chokes (backup, various sizes)
- May have multiple choke options

**Valves:**
- Isolation valves (gate valves)
- HCR valve (hydraulic control)
- Buffer chamber valves
- Routing valves

**Instrumentation:**
- Upstream pressure gauge (casing pressure)
- Downstream pressure gauge
- Pressure recorders

**Flow Path:**
- Multiple routing options
- To mud gas separator (MGS)
- To flare
- To reserve pit

3.5.3.title: Adjustable Chokes
3.5.3.content:
**Types:**

**Positive Choke:**
- Fixed orifice size
- Change bean to change size
- Simple but requires shutdown to change

**Adjustable Choke:**
- Variable orifice size
- Adjusted during operation
- Manual wheel or hydraulic remote
- Essential for well control

**Operation:**
- Turning handle opens/closes orifice
- Opening = less restriction = lower back pressure
- Closing = more restriction = higher back pressure
- Small adjustments have significant effect

3.5.4.title: Operating the Choke
3.5.4.content:
**During Well Kill:**
- Choke operator maintains constant drillpipe pressure
- As conditions change, adjust choke
- Pump speed increase → Open choke slightly
- Pump speed decrease → Close choke slightly
- Gas at choke → May need continuous adjustment

**Key Principles:**
- Make small adjustments
- Wait to see effect before adjusting more
- Watch drillpipe pressure as primary indicator
- Casing pressure changes - don't chase it

**Coordination:**
- Driller controls pump
- Choke operator controls back pressure
- Must communicate continuously
- Closed-loop communication essential

3.5.5.title: Testing
3.5.5.content:
**Pressure Test:**
- Test manifold to working pressure
- Include all valves and fittings
- Test upstream (BOP side) always
- Test downstream where possible

**Function Test:**
- Verify all valves operate
- Check choke adjustment through full range
- Test remote operation if equipped
- Verify instrumentation accurate

**Frequency:**
- Initial installation
- After maintenance
- Per regulatory requirements
- When BOP tested (often combined)

3.5.6.title: Maintenance
3.5.6.content:
**Erosion:**
- Chokes and fittings erode with flow
- Inspect regularly
- Replace choke trim as needed
- Monitor for thinning

**Valves:**
- Gate valves should be full open or full closed
- Operate valves periodically to prevent seizing
- Pack valves as needed

**Cleanliness:**
- Keep manifold area clean
- Clear access for operation
- Protect instruments

**Spares:**
- Keep spare choke trim on location
- Spare valve parts
- Gaskets and seals
